embeds.title: Body Crash
embeds.description:
Rare Attack / 2 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Gain 5 (8) **Block** :p_block:.
Deal damage equal to your **Block** :p_block:.

messages.content: It’s no Body Slam, but it’s still really good
nerfed card

definitely harder to use than before, the 2-cost being especially clunky, but still hits hard because guardian is really good at generating block with defensive mode, both the 10 block on entry/exit, and the blur effect between them.

the problem is the cost, as it makes it harder to generate block, but also juggle in stasis to time the damage well. i think that's a somewhat reasonable price to pay for such a powerful effect, but i certainly wouldn't mind it being slightly easier. also the upgrade sucks
Yeah that upgrade is really bad
I can't really think of a good upgrade for it
you know what'd be really spicy?
"place this card into stasis"
that's probably way too good though
1 cost might be "too much" but there's also shield throw which is insane
on champ
Champ has been on the docket for "needs massive ballance changes" for some time now.
<shield throw>

a wallop-esque card
especially since this can do 100+ sometimes

brace is just flat amounts and some powers right now, plus two relics
brace scaling is just interesting to me

messages.content: With this its a gimmicy combo card that requires far too much setup
that's absolutely not true

ironclad may be used to using this as a carry card with certain combos like barricade, entrench, or feel no pain, but guardian's block is more consistent and controlled, and while they can make tons of block to use this as a pure carry card, you'll still get good value on "off"-turns
it was definitely more of a single carry card before the nerf, now it's a significant supporting damage of an offensive system
reminder that Sandtag plays Guardian like me, but without the influence you have had upon me
he's done enough runs to have a playstyle?
i guess with the number of mods he's played, there has to be a playstyle of some kind across them all 🤔
that reminds me, i'd like to watch you play guardian sometime and see the playstyle choices in action
although with our internets combined, a stream is off the table lmao

embeds.title: Resilient Plate
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / 1 :energy_guardian: / The Guardian / Downfall

Reduce each of your debuffs by 2.
**Brace** 8.
​~~- **Exhaust**. -~~

messages.content: in a couple of months my internet will most likely improve
cool

To start with, it's unfair to compare this to body slam, we had body slam at uncommon for a while on guardian, and it was absolutely busted. Between guardians defensive mode, dexterity scaling, generally strong block cards, stasis being incredibly strong with 0 cost cards, and reroute/recover to loop body slam, it was just way too strong. I think that shifting it into something else was absolutely the right call.

Body Crash still has major synergies with defensive mode and dexterity scaling, but it much harder to set up/loop through stasis. It functions as a way to convert your natural strength at making block into a way to deal heavy burst damage. This is a pretty important role, and it's relatively unique within guardians kit, which can make it a very desirable rare if you have a very defensive deck and/or calipers/guardian gear. It's fairly swingy/random, because if you draw it on the wrong turn, it will be pretty weak, but drawing it on the right turn (having blurred over a ton of block from the previous turn) it can be extremely powerful. Having the 4th energy, as well as good/upgraded block cards becomes more important in order to smooth out body crash's output. It's like a dash that can scale the damage element based on how much other block you've generated this turn, and you really don't want to be adding this to your deck if it will mostly function as worse dash.

Much stronger with runic pyramid to line it up with defensive mode, or frozen eye to prepare yourself for when you will draw it. Can be devastating when timed with pen nib, or doubled by necronomicon. Pretty decent snecko eye card as well, though you may have trouble playing block cards before this if they become expensive. The upgrade is reasonable, a cost reduction to 1 would be appreciated for stasis, but probably too good. The current upgrade is in line with dash, and is still a +6 to output overall on a 2 cost card.
It could start at 6 block and not be too powerful, or get a +4 on upgrade, to make it feel better as a rare.
